CANDIDATE NAME

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[619, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 214, 902, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 267, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 374]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 387, 406]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 767, 560]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions. Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 757, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 919, 120]]<|/det|>
Model trains move along a track passing through two model stations. Students analyse the motion of a train. They start a digital timer as the train starts to move. They record the time that it enters Station A and the time it enters Station B.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 135, 777, 151]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows the time on entering Station A and the time on entering Station B.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[176, 163, 820, 330]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 351, 532, 368]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 383, 146, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[479, 429, 918, 445]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 568, 918, 584]]<|/det|>

In a geothermal power station, the process of generating electricity includes seven stages. Four of the stages are shown below.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 416, 372, 432]]<|/det|>
P steam turns a turbine

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 438, 545, 454]]<|/det|>
Q hot underground rocks heat the cold water

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 460, 435, 476]]<|/det|>
R the turbine spins a generator

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 483, 435, 498]]<|/det|>
S hot water rises to the surface

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 514, 918, 546]]<|/det|>
